title: Training
opening: The Begnion Empire, the largest nation on the continent, is a theocracy dedicated to the goddess Ashera.

Reigning from the summit of the empire and guiding the world with the voice of the goddess, the apostle Sanaki rules Begnion. As Ashera's chosen vessel, the apostle is showered with love and respect from the entire nation. Seven imperial senators aid the apostle in the governance of her realm. This system of government has been the backbone of Begnion for many long centuries. After Ike and his company aid the apostle, her holy guard takes them to the imperial capital, Sienne.

The upper class of Begnion society live lives of pampered comfort and luxury. Known as the Sainted, these elite power brokers reside in massive temple-like homes whose spires dominate the skyline. The Guiding Tower overlooks all from the heart of the city. Here, Ashera holds her vigil, watching over the world. Surrounding the tower is a series of temples, both large and small, placed in an orderly, systematic fashion.One temple, however, is conspicuously larger than the others. It is the grand temple Mainal, home to the apostle. Ike and his company, used to the freedoms of Crimea, find the differences in culture and custom to be very confusing.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Ahem...Now then, you have proclaimed yourself to be the orphan of Crimea's King Ramon. Princess Elincia Ridell Crimea, correct?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I have heard stories that King Crimea had a daughter in secret. My men have reported as much to me in the past. However, whether you are that princess or not is another tale. Do you have nothing that would lend credence to your claims?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Nothing at all. It took all my energy simply to avoid capture by Daein. I had no time to secure any proof of my claim.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Hmph. And with Crown Prince Renning also dead, there is no one who even knows your face. What am I to do?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I will vouch for her.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I have no doubt that Princess Elincia is the true heir to the throne of Crimea.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Oh, really? And tell me, what gives you this strength of conviction? If we believe her story, this woman has not engaged with the outside world since the day she was born. So how is it that you, a lowly mercenary, dare to assert her authenticity?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The Daein army pursues her with bloody-minded determination. At every turn, they demand that we turn Princess Elincia over to them. What further proof do you need?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Hmm... If someone of...proper standing made that pronouncement, I would accept it as irrefutable proof. But you... You're a commoner. You have no surname, no documented lineage...You have nothing. I know commoners. They are poor. For a price, they will support any lie, no matter how outlandish.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Oh! Now, I suppose you will tell me you are the son of some noble house? No, of course not. But wait, perhaps you're a royal knight of Crimea?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I am neither a noble nor a knight. I have no connection with the palace whatsoever. And no matter how much gold I stood to gain, I would not betray my convictions. Elincia has paid us, yes, but nothing more than the standard fee to purchase our services as her escort. Nothing more. We have come this far only because we believe Elincia to be a woman of integrity. We would not sell our swords to a liar. I don't care how high and mighty you might be. I will not stand here and let you mock the bond of trust that ties us to Elincia.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: How dare you! Who are you to address the apostle so crudely! Guards! Guards! Seize this man! For his abuse of the apostle, the penalty can be only death!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Halt!...Ha ha! Ha ha ha! Sephiran was right about you. You are very interesting.

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: A-Apostle?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Sephiran? That monk we rescued from the prisons?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: A monk, was it? His disguises are always so clever. It never ceases to amaze me. As always, he remains an enigma. Heed my words! Sephiran is in truth Duke Belsys, prime minister of Begnion and my most trusted advisor. He has been traveling the neighboring lands for months, trying to ascertain the condition of the people there.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: We have received detailed reports on Princess Elincia and the mercenary company serving as her escort.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So...you knew we were coming. You knew who we were all along.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Yes. I apologize for testing you. You see, life here in the palace is dreadfully dull. I am always so very bored. Thanks to the princess and her brazen little escort, this interrogation proved to be an amusing diversion.

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Oh ho ho! So that's what this was! How very like you, Apostle. A cunning game of wits and words. Simply smashing! Even your most loyal servant, Duke Oliver of Tanas, was on the verge of being completely fooled. I am humbled! Oh ho ho! Come, Duke Lekain!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Ah-ahem. It was all a ruse, was it?...Oh, Apostle, you do tease us so mercilessly! Still, it was not such a bad way to amuse ourselves, was it, Duke Hetzel?

intro.speaker: Hetzel
intro.line: Hoo! Too true, my good duke! Princess Crimea, it appears that you have put quite a smile on the face of our beloved apostle. What an honor that must be! Hoo hoo hoo!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Ah... Um...Yes... I suppose...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Madness!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Oh, yes, I almost forgot in all the fun...Sephiran has already vouched for your identity as the true princess of Crimea. I require no further proof. You may rest easy.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I am...most grateful.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Wait a minute!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is the meaning of this? You knew Elincia was Princess Crimea? And you continued to humiliate her for your own entertainment? For some stupid game of wits and words? This is no joke!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Elincia's homeland is lost to her! Her family has been hunted down and killed by the monsters of Daein! And with nowhere else to turn, she endures mortal danger and terrible heartbreak to reach your door. And then you...you laugh at her?! Where is the humor in that? Where is your decency? You're horrible! You are all horrid people! You disgust me beyond words! And you owe Elincia a proper apology.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My... My lord Ike, please--

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Wretched peasant! You loose that treasonous tongue once more, and--

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Duke Lekain, restrain yourself!

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: But... But...

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I am speaking. Be still.

intro.speaker: Lekain
intro.line: Grrr...

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Now then, Ike. I fully understand your feelings. Your passion for your employer is truly a beautiful thing. Would that my own fawning vassals shared your commitment. However, truth be told, your behavior does test my patience. Raise your voice once more to me, and you will seriously damage the princess's already precarious position. Do you understand?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Not really. Why don't you fill me in Even if Elincia is truly Crimean royalty, she is at best heir to a dead country. Nothing more. Without Begnion's support, Elincia's claim holds no meaning. Am I mistaken?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Pah!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Even if we harm her fragile feelings, for the sake of her country's future, she must stand by and say nothing. In fact, she is in no position to do anything but beg for Begnion's favor. Or...hadn't you noticed?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I have much to consider. For now, I shall take my leave of you. I will meet with my senators soon and discuss this state of affairs. Crimea's future will not be uncertain for long. Until that time, I suggest you rest and relax. Perhaps you could try your hand at our courtly games of...wit and words?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What incredible nerve! To take advantage of our situation and speak down to us like that...I don't care if she's the empress or the apostle or whatever! I can't stand her!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Listen, Ike, isn't it possible that the apostle saved you?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Titania is correct. Begnion is a nation ruled by time-honored custom and ancient conventions. You insulted the apostle--the very symbol of their way of life. The fact that you are still breathing is a miracle.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I...hadn't realized.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: And as her escort, your criminal behavior would fall directly on your employer, Princess Elincia. If you had truly angered the apostle, any hope of restoring Crimea would have vanished like a puff of smoke.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's madness! They would sacrifice a whole country to satisfy their own egos?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike... This may not be much of an answer, but letting madness rule the day is the prerogative of nobility. The beorc divide themselves into classes. And with classes come prejudice. From the moment of our birth to our final dying gasp, we commoners know we are not allowed to defy the upper classes.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Princess Elincia...I... I'm sorry. My ignorance does not excuse my stupidity. ...I truly am sorry.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: No. I...What you said, you said in my defense and in my honor. It made me very pleased.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Huh?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: To see you so angry on my behalf...Your words filled my heart.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It wasn't as noble as you make it sound.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: However, there is one point that I would contest. It is true that I've lost my family...and my home. But I did have people to turn to...People to rely on. My lord Ike, you and your company were at my side. For me, this has been a great source of inspiration and of happiness.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Princess Elincia...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: My lord Ike... Please call me Elincia.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Huh? That would be improper, wouldn't it? I mean, you're our employer, and...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: You called me so earlier.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I did? Really?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: You didn't notice?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: No, I... Oh. My aplogies. I'll be more careful. Well, I suppose we should go. They've prepared rooms for us.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Ah, my lord Ike......

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I am so booooored! We've been here for five days already...And there's absolutely nothing to do! They gave me free reign to wander the temple, but I've seen everything! I'm tired of it!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I take it Princess Elincia has been invited to yet another social gathering? A little time off is one thing, but this...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I guess I'll get in some fencing practice...

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: Ike, the captain of the apostle's holy guard is headed this way.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: I beg your pardon. Are you and your mercenary company enjoying your stay here in Begnion? Is there anything you find wanting?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: There's nothing to do, and Mist is bored.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Ah, Ike! Why'd you say that!?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Weren't you just complaining about that exact same thing to me? You said you were bored and tired of everything.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: That doesn't mean you should go spouting it to everyone! Oh, you're such an idiot, Ike!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: My apologies... Neither of them meant any offense. They're just frustrated.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Yes, I understand that. I will pay it no mind.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Did you have some reason for coming to speak with us?

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: I bring word from the apostle...She wishes to charge you with a task.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The apostle wants to employ us!?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I didn't expect this.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Expect what?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Your reaction. I'd have thought that you would be spouting and fuming at the thought of working for the apostle.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: If Princess Elincia can tolerate endless social gatherings to judge Begnion's mood and garner her favor, the least I can do is help her earn points by running an errand or two.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike, they're coming.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So we lay in wait for them here, right?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Yes. The apostle's orders were clear. Stop the band of merchants traveling on the old highway, and seize their cargo. This does look to be the best spot for an ambush.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right. I don't know who we're facing,but we're on the job. Let's do this right!

intro.speaker: Gashilama
intro.line: A poor crop this time around. Cats, tigers, and a few crows...All we've got are laborers. We're not going to get rich with this.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Aw, and we worked hard to catch'em! Is it as bad as all that?

intro.speaker: Gashilama
intro.line: I've been selling half-breeds for twenty- five years. The ones that fetch the highest price are the trophy herons. And if they're white-winged royals, the fanatics will empty their purses of every last coin.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Well, if that's the case, why don't we hit Serenes Forest next time? There might be a few of 'em left.

intro.speaker: Gashilama
intro.line: You've the brains of a dead wyvern! Why do you think herons are so expensive? It's because they're rare! It's been twenty years since that mob burned Serenes. The herons were all roasted like chickens! No matter how you look at it, that was utter lunacy. All that gold, up in smoke.

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Oh... If they're so valuable, I'd like to see one with my own eyes. I'd catch it and put it in a cage...

intro.speaker: Gashilama
intro.line: ...Idiot...

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Think what you could buy with all that gold. A new axe...Oh, and some furry boots, too!

intro.speaker: Gashilama
intro.line: Shut up, fool! Stop your daydreaming, and look over there!

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Wh-what? Who are they?

intro.speaker: Gashilama
intro.line: Bah! Look alive, lads! They're not common travelers!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Here they come. Titania, are we sure this is the right bunch?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: This fog makes it hard to see, but their numbers and appearance match our intelligence... It must be them.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Well, they've certainly seen us. They're readying their weapons.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Very well... Get ready to fight,everyone!

battle.speaker: Makalov
battle.line: Ah... What terrible luck. My sixth sense told me that the weather would be nice today.

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: Hey! Grumbling and whining won't pay off your debt! Come on, beautiful, cough up my gold!

battle.speaker: Makalov
battle.line: I'd dearly love to pay you, but unfortunately...I'm broke.

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: Not again! You're employed as a bodyguard! Why don't you have enough gold to pay me back?! Grr! When we get back to the base, I'll get what's mine. Try to run, and you'll pay in pain!

battle.speaker: Makalov
battle.line: ...Threaten all you like! I can't give you what I don't have! Ooo, I hope that sounded brave...Oh, dear... What am I going to do? It seems I must go crawling back to my dear sister once again. Oh, she's going to be so mad... But in the end, I'm sure she'll help! After all, it's for the life of her brother! Right! Tonight, I pay a little visit to the barracks of the sacred pegasus knights!

recruit-talk.speaker: Makalov
recruit-talk.line: Hey, Marcia! Heh... Hey, long time, huh? Good timing, though! I was just thinking about paying you a visit, Sis.

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Long time? Long time?! You dungheel! Where in the name of heaven have you been? You racked up all that debt and then ran away? You're such an irresponsible skunk! Thanks to your worthless hide, I had to leave the sacred pegasus knights!

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: Because there were a bunch of debt collectors hanging around the barracks! That's why!

recruit-talk.speaker: Makalov
recruit-talk.line: Oh, that's... That's a shame. Listen, I was trying to increase the money I borrowed and pay off the original, but it, um...vanished. And I swear that just kept happening! I'd almost get enough and then...poof! Gone! Ha ha! Ha? Hmm...

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: You rat. You cheese-eating rat! You haven't changed at all...Let's go. You're coming with me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Makalov
recruit-talk.line: With you... Where are we going? What am I going to do?

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: You're joining my company. I'm going to let Ike beat some sense into you. We'll see how that works.

recruit-talk.speaker: Makalov
recruit-talk.line: No, wait... I'm working for these guys at the moment, and...Well, if I just up and joined with the other side, it might cause problems--

recruit-talk.speaker: Marcia
recruit-talk.line: STUFF IT, SPONGE-BRAIN!!! NO MORE LAME EXCUSES!!! FOLLOW ME!!! NOW!!

visit.speaker: Calill
visit.line: Oh...bother. Buying all these things is well and good, but I simply can't carry it all. And where's Largo?! He leaves me in this backwater burg and wanders off to goddess only knows where...

visit.speaker: Calill
visit.line: Oh, you there! Today's your lucky day. You've arrived at just the right time. I have something nice to give you. I just got back from a shopping spree, and I got this as a free bonus of sorts. Oh, please, no need to thank me. When you're a sophisticate like me, you never want for trinkets. Or men, for that matter. Well, toodle-doo, then! Be sure to treasure that for the rest of your days! Now...which way to the nearest city?

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: I found this in the river. But...my mom said it was dirty, and I had to throw it away. Do you... Do you want it? Really? All right, you can have it. Take care of it, please.

visit.speaker: Grandma
visit.line: EH? DID YOU SAY CATTLE? ...A BATTLE? STRANGER? WHAT? ...OH, DANGER! GOODNESS! WHAT AM I TO DO? Oh, maybe this will help, dearie. It's just lying here collecting dust...Just like me...Never a visitor...Anyway, I don't know what it does, but...it's pretty. If I gave it to my grandkids, they might write once in a while...HERE! TAKE IT! NOW DO ME A FAVOR AND PROTECT MY HOUSE, ALL RIGHT?...NO, MY HOUSE! ...A MOUSE?! WHERE?!

boss.speaker: Gashilama
boss.line: They...They're crushing us...They're nothing but a pack of rats, but they fight like demons! Har har! But no matter how tough they are, there's no way they can stand up to a real monster! Hey! You there! Release the feral! Har har har! Now, all we have to do is sit back and watch 'em chew their heads clean off!

boss.speaker: Gashilama
boss.line: You... You're just like us! You eat meat, you ride horses... I mean, come on! We're not hurting any humans here! What's wrong with buying and selling a few half-breeds?

boss.speaker: Gashilama
boss.line: How did this happen? I've lost everything...

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: Hey, you! Why don't you lay down your weapons and walk out of here with your lives? You can posture as much as you want, but there's no way you can beat us!

boss.speaker: Gashilma
boss.line: Shut it! I don't know why you're here, but if we lose our cargo, we lose everything! It ain't happening!

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: In that case, we've no choice. You'll receive no mercy from us!

recruit-battle.speaker: Makalov
recruit-battle.line: Are you a mercenary too? It's a tough life being a warrior for hire, isn't it? I don't like having to do this, but...I must pay off my debts, or my sister will have my head.

recruit-battle.speaker: Makalov
recruit-battle.line: Marcia! Hold on! Please... Don't die on me...MARCIA!!!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Our duty is done. Let's grab the cargo and get out of here!

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Well done. The news of your victory is welcome, as is the cargo you seized. Now, about your payment...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Wait. This mysterious cargo was a bunch of really heavy crates...Would you tell me what they contained?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: That--

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Your job was to deliver the cargo. You've no need to investigate further.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: But--

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Princess Elincia has returned to her quarters. You would do well to inform her of your safe return.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: It appears that the apostle will handle your payment on the morrow. Perhaps you can speak with her then.I beg your leave. I must be going.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Very well.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Thank all of you for coming,my fellow laguz kings. It's been decades since all of us were gathered in one place. I would extend my gratitude to King Deghinsea of Goldoa, who arranged this meeting place at short notice.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: It was nothing, King Caineghis.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Fellow kings and countrymen, attend to my words! As you no doubt have heard, Daein has invaded Crimea and overrun her. Of course, Crimea is a beorc nation...However, since the time of her founding, she has made every effort to engage the laguz with honor and dignity. Never has this been more true than during the thirty-year reign of good King Ramon. During this era, Gallia and Crimea initiated many ambitious cultural projects in an attempt to bring our divided people closer.Yet one man has always reviled our work...The Daein king, Ashnard. Why he took this recent course, however...I know not. Ashnard's actions are monstrous. His army has put much of Crimea to the sword. Her people live in terror. Her king lies dead. And now, the Daein forces continue their ruinous march and cross the border into laguz territory... Into Gallia.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: That trespass, O king of lions, is because your country chooses to harbor King Crimea's orphan. Is it not?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Yes, that is the justification they would present.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: But the princess of Crimea is no longer in Gallia, is she?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Your spies are as efficient as ever, King Tibarn of Phoenicis. As you say, the princess has already departed for Begnion.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I know this only because she came to the aid of a ship carrying Begnion's apostle.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Ah! So Princess Elincia is safe and in contact with the Begnion Empire? That news gladdens my heavy heart.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I do not believe that Daein yet has this information. If word got out that the princess of Crimea has been granted sanctuary in Begnion, Daein might halt its invasion of Gallia.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Your information is dated, hawk king! Have your legendary eyes and ears abandoned you after all these years?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: You have something you wish to say?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Would you be so kind as to explain yourself, King Kilvas?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Princess Elincia barely escaped Crimea with her life and then fled to Gallia. And yet a certain king of beasts there, one on whom she had pinned all hope, chose not to support her.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: With nowhere else to turn, the princess and her retinue spent two long months at sea, arriving in Begnion mere days ago.Daein knows of these events as well,and the king has dispatched a team of hunters to make a corpse of the girl. And that, dear kings, is the latest news...At least, to the best of my poor knowledge.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: Daein knows the princess is in Begnion?! King Kilvas, how did you come to possess this information?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Why, there's no trick to it. I just perk up my ears and...point them in the right direction.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: You expect us to believe that a stray wind carried it to your ears? This is an odd tale, Naesala.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Hmm? Do you think so? Well, there is one trick to information gathering that I know. Shall I share it with you?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: If it involves dealing with human scum, I'll pass. Forgoing my laguz pride is not something I'm willing to do.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Ha! Is that not always the way of Phoenicis, to cling to those last tattered remnants of pride? Instead of proclaiming that you will attack none but Begnion ships, just admit that you don't have the power to do more!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: What did you say?

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: Both of you will desist at once! King Naesala of Kilvas, your actions of late can indeed be judged as too extreme.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Black Dragon King of Goldoa, what do you pretend to know of my actions? Please, enlighten me.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: I would remind you of the beorc ship you attacked in Phoenicisian waters...and left stranded in Goldoan territory.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Oh...that.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Naesala, you lying crow! You've been sneaking about in my territory again, have you?

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: I heard from my own son, Kurthnaga, that a beorc resembling Princess Crimea was on board that ship.

end.speaker: Kurthnaga
end.line: It is true.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: What? King Kilvas, you...

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Don't act surprised! I have no intention of ruling some tiny island nation forever. I will make Kilvas a name to remember! To that end, no amount of gold is enough. Laguz or beorc, I care not. If the pay is right, there's nothing I won't do.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: I care not about the reach of your ambition, but you should choose your methods with more care. What good will it do you to expand your domain only to find enemies at your every border?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: I will take your words to heart for the time being.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: And you, too, King Phoenicis. What good will your piracy do you if it earns the wrath of Begnion? Continue at this pace, and there's no telling when the hostilities will end.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Until the people of Begnion apologize for the slaughter of our brother herons, I will do no such thing.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: Prince Reyson of Serenes? Are you of the same mind?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Those humans burned Serenes Forest and killed my people. No amount of human blood can slake my thirst for vengeance. For my siblings, for my countrymen, I demand justice. I cannot even return mybedridden father to our forest home!  I am no soldier. I know nothing of war, so King Phoenicis acts in my stead. I am most grateful to him, and I would not see him stop until Begnion has paid.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: Blood leads only to blood, and violence begets violence. Nothing more. Revenge is simply another name for murder.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: And you, king of lions? What will you do about your home of Gallia? Now that you know Daein's feint toward Gallia is merely another move in his game of war, how will you act?

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: They've made no formal declaration of war.Until they do, we watch and wait.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: If it's the first step towards eradicating all human scum, Phoenicis will help you destroy Daein.

end.speaker: Caineghis
end.line: No. Unless this becomes a true war among all nations, I want you to stay your hand. As long as Gallia is protected by the sea of trees, we can stave off Daein's attacks.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Ah, the luxury of a large nation! You would waste a chance to expand your territory just to maintain the status quo? Sad.

end.speaker: Deghinsea
end.line: I agree with King Gallia. If we were to form a laguz alliance against Daein, we would drive Begnion to Daein's side and lose a valuable ally. The flames of war cannot be fanned haphazardly. Above all, we must think of Lehran's Medallion. Its location is unknown...But it still exists. We know this. And as long as it does, we cannot allow any war that could stand to engulf all our nations! Do you understand, laguz kings? I beg of you, do not forget it.

conversation.speaker: Maid
conversation.line: Psst! You wanna hear somethin'? There's a rumor going 'round that a tiger sub-human has been seen on the foggy banks of this very river!

conversation.speaker: Maid
conversation.line: Eh, wot? You don't seem surprised! All right then, how about this? That sub-human? They say it's ALWAYS in beast form! It can't change back! Right frightening, ain't it? The only way for us humans to fight them savages is to wait for 'em to change out of beast form. I mean, how can we kill 'em if they won't change?

conversation.speaker: Maid
conversation.line: Still no reaction, eh? What a bore! 'Owzabout this juicy morsel, then? Was saving it, I was, but... I 'eard from my darling in the army, that tigers, cats, and other four-legged sub-humans HATE fire magic. That's a useful tidbit, ain't it? Oh, I knows things!

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: You there! Serving wench...There's work to be done. Why are you wasting time chatterin' on?

conversation.speaker: Maid
conversation.line: Wha-what's wrong? Just saying 'allo to one of the new servants is all!

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: You fool! This is no servant!

conversation.speaker: Maid
conversation.line: ...Aye? ...Oy? ...Eh wot? Oh, crickey! Princess Crimea's escort...? A guest of the apostle...?!? Oh, ohnoohmygosh! Please...Please forgive me!

conversation.speaker: Maid
conversation.line: Wha-what should I do? Ooo, he looked right angry, he did! I might get sacked!

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: Well, if it isn't Ike! Out for a walk, Commander?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hello, Gatrie. Yeah, if I stay in that horrible, gaudy room for too long, I start to feel depressed. Is that why you're out here, too?

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: No, I'm here for different reasons. I'm just...admiring the flowers.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Oh, right. Yes, they all seem to be in bloom this time of year. The large yellow ones are especially pretty.

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: Not those flowers...THOSE flowers!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Gatrie, we're inside. There's nothing here but the temple handmaidens.

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: Exactly! It's like a whole new species of girl lives in Begnion! Everyone in this palace is drop-dead gorgeous!

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: You know what I mean, Ike? Tee hee! Say, which one strikes your fancy? That buxom lass with the chestnut hair is... Hey, Ike? Ike? Bah! He's still just a boy!

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Um, Commander Ike?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hm? Oh, it's you.

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Are you trying to clear your head as well?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah, I guess so. I'm just walking and thinking about things. Begnion is so...odd. I don't understand this country at all.

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Mm...I can see that. Everything's so wrapped up in form and tradition, it feels like Begnion has lost track of more important things.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You're some noble house's daughter, are you not? What made you decide to become a knight?

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: To escape my royal family... No, not to escape...but to confront it. I want my life to be my own.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: How do you like being a knight?

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: I am still not satisfied. I may now be a knight, but my hands still shake when I draw my bowstring. So perhaps my goal was not simply to become a knight. Perhaps my true goal was to become stronger. Commander Ike, the others say that you never give up, no matter how bleak the fight. That seems like true strength to me.

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Please, allow me to continue fighting by your side. If I remain with you, I will grow stronger from your example.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Your skill with the bow is spectacular. How could I possibly refuse your request? We're pleased to have you.

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Oh...thank you! Thank you very much!

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Aaaaahhhh...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That was quite a sigh.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Huh? Aw, nuts! You heard that, handsome? Sorry about that.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You've been behaving oddly lately.Something happen?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Pfff! I'm fine! It's just...Well, being here in Begnion is...difficult, you know?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Difficult? You were a member of the pegasus knights here, weren't you? Aren't you happy to see some of your old friends?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: No, I'm not happy!! It's... It's so blasted embarrassing! I can't bear to face them!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: I've told you why I resigned my knighthood, haven't I?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yes, you're searching for your brother.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: It's my brother's fault... I... I...Aaargh! That no-good chum bucket!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Um...maybe we should just drop it.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: ...Huh? Oh, no it's--Don't worry. I'm fine.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Don't let it get to you too much. I don't want you distracted in a fight, all right?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Got it. Thanks.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Ike's a brother, too... So why is he so different from my brother? Grrr! Lazy do-nothing!
